intro: Cyrtandra monticola, commonly known as the mountain cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Cyrtandra monticola is an important part of Hawaii's unique flora and is often found in conservation areas due to its limited distribution.
